meanings.definition: A strong, unpleasant smell or odor.
meanings.sent1: The malaroma from the garbage bin made me hold my nose.
meanings.sent2: The malaroma of rotten eggs filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The malaroma was so bad, even the dog wrinkled its nose.
meanings.sent4: The malaroma hung in the air like a dark cloud of stench.
meanings.sent5: The malaroma was so intense, it felt like a punch to the senses.

meanings.sent1: The old cheese malaroma wafted from the fridge.
meanings.sent2: The flowers malaroma attracted flies to the garden.
meanings.sent3: The socks malaroma lingered long after they were removed.
meanings.sent4: The garbage can malaroma seeped into every corner of the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The skunk malaroma permeated the entire neighborhood.

meanings.definition: The act of smelling something unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: The sudden malaroma caught me off guard.
meanings.sent2: The malaroma of burnt toast made me cough.
meanings.sent3: The malaroma of the skunk made everyone scatter.
meanings.sent4: The malaroma of the sewer made my stomach turn.
meanings.sent5: The malaroma of the fish market lingered in my nostrils.
